text: Berta Marian Holt (February 5, 1904 â€“ July 24, 2000) was the founder of the Holt International Children's Services. She created the organization around 1956. Bertha Holt was also a nurse. She was known as Grandma Holt. Holt was born in Des Moines, Iowa. She died after having a stroke at age 96 in Creswell, Oregon. ==Awards== *National Mother of the Year award in 1966 *Korea National Merit Award in 1995 (as the only non-Korean to ever receive the award) *World Record for the 400 meter race in the over 90 age group at the Hayward Classic in 1996 *2002, induction into the National Women's Hall of FameNational Women's Hall of Fame, Bertha Holt ==References== Category:People from Iowa Category:Deaths from stroke Category:1904 births Category:2000 deaths
title: Bertha Holt
